sect1.title: Quick presentation
sect1.para: The FlyMine Project has its own domain @flymine.org but users may also have aliases like @gen.cam.ac.uk. All emails are kept on a FlyMine private server.

sect2.title: Client settings
sect2.para: Users are free to choose the MUA (i.e. email client) they want as long as it doesn't run directly on the server and is compatible with either IMAPS or POP3S. IMAPS is recommended since emails stay on the server but can easily deal with synchronisation and off-line reading.

sect2.title: Mail transport
sect2.para: As FlyMine is using the Cambridge University networks, both inbound and outbound traffic is passing through the ppsw.cam.ac.uk cluster of servers. One of the advantages is the mail is kept in case of unavailability of the FlyMine server but it also means there is no control at all on the queue.
For security reasons, normal POP and IMAP which allow clear text password are not available even on the internal network.

sect2.title: Imap Server
sect2.para: The previous "University of Washington IMAP" server has been replaced by Cyrus Imap. Among the new features, the most useful might be possibility of creating nested folders. Messages are kept on specific repository and are not visible at the filesystem level for a normal user (they are owned by "cyrus"). The (user) email filtering is done by "sieve" not by exim.

sect2.title: Server
sect2.para: The mail server (flymine.flymine.org) resides in the DMZ and is actually shared with some other services like DNS, CVS, Web, etc... The integrity of data is provided by disk mirroring. There is currently no backup policy.
